events.name: BeMyApp World Cup Singapore
events.about:
BeMyApp WeekEnd is a three-day mobile app development competition taking place around the world since June 2010. The event’s goal is to foster a global community of entrepreneurs and to be a medium for team-formation and agile product development.

Hackathon with a spirit, BeMyApp aspires to promote an encounter between imagination and execution, where competition and collaboration go hand in hand.

 

The App Challenge

Follow mobile app news
& updates by BeMyApp

  •  Facebook
  •  Twitter
  •  sg.bemyapp.com

Registered idea generators are given 1 minute to pitch an app concept to a tech audience on day one. Attending engineers and designers preselect the best ideas that will be developed into applications during the weekend. Teams are formed around the most promising projects and the competition begins. By Sunday evening, all competing teams should have a working prototype to demo in front of the panel of Judges.

 


The World Cup


Examples and Past 
Success Stories

  • Namerick
  • JesterChess
  • Starjar
  • Kinvolved
  • Lalilala
  • Deezy
  • Ujoolt
  • FoodReporter
  • PostrWall

The BeMyApp World Cup is open to all mobile platforms - both native and html5 apps - and will take place in 4 cities around the world: San Francisco, Singapore, Paris and Berlin.

A panel of judges in each city will nominate the best local app to continue in the finals and BeMyApp will be launching a 48hrs worldwide vote to nominate the Global Winner. The best prize youll get are the connections you forge and the challenges you conquer. That said, weve got some pretty sweet cherry-on-top prizes planned and more are coming up too, so stay tuned for the updates!

 

Schedule

FRIDAY 

7pm - Opening

8pm - Idea Pitches

9pm - Team Creation

10pm - Brainstorming and First Lines of Code

1am - Closing

SATURDAY

9am - Opening

12pm - First Video CheckPoint

12am - Closing

SUNDAY

9am - Opening

12pm - Second Video CheckPoint

7pm - First Demos Presented

9pm - Winner Announcement (public)

-----

MONDAY, DECEMBER 10

9am - Online vote opening

WEDNESDAY, DECEMBER 12

8am - BeMyApp World Cup winner announcement

 
Want to join in but have questions?  Read on...
 
What do I need to be an idea generator?
You can be anyone with an app idea who wants to build a team and a prototype. Plan to dedicate the whole weekend, help and lead your team. We would like to encourage original and innovative ideas that will be build from scratch, so please bring something fresh to pitch!

What platforms can I develop for?
Any! Whether it’s an iPhone, Android, HTML5, Windows Phone app or a tablet app, we’re there to support you in building it!

Do I need to have a certain level of experience to get involved?
No, the event is about learning as well as applying your skills so you can get involved no matter how experienced you are.

What’s expected of me over the weekend?
You’ll get most out of the weekend by joining a team and building a working prototype of a mobile app. Please, plan to dedicate the whole weekend as your team will need you.

What should I bring?
Your enthusiasm, your portable computer, the mobile device you’re building for and your camera to immortalize the making of your application!

What is the judging criteria for the apps?
The apps will be judged on their stickiness, innovation, business potential and execution.

Who owns the apps created?
The apps are owned solely by their creators – we’ll provide you with some terms which you can use so your team knows where they all stand. Do note that we do not get involved legally so it is important that you discuss this with your team before you start on the prototype so everyone is clear on ownership.

 


Got more questions or interested in sponsoring? Please, contact singapore at bemyapp dot com

events.name: UP Singapore Arthur Guinness Fund Hackathon: Empowering Marginalised Women
events.about:
UP Singapore is partnering with the Arthur Guinness Fund (AGF) to host a Hackathon focusing on the Empowerment of Marginalised Women in Singapore. We will be asking participants to think of ways social enterprise can help single mothers and female ex-offenders get a better foothold in the workplace and society. For more information visit www.upsingapore.com/agf

Were looking for passionate participants from all walks of life, who want to put their skills to work to help marginalised women. Whether you are a developer, programmer, designer, creative, entrepreneur, corporate or government employee, or just a motivated citizen, we need your input at this hackathon!

Participation is FREE, but there is be a $10 refundable deposit required to secure your place.

There will be two pre-event brainstorming workshops. If youre interested in attending, follow these links to sign up:

Brainstorming how to empower Single Mothers

www.agfbrainstorm1.eventbrite.com

Brainstorming how to empower Female Ex-Offenders

www.agfbrainstorm2.eventbrite.com

Hackathon Weekend Schedule:

Friday 7th December, 7pm – 10pm, The Hub, Somerset 

7pm: Registration, dinner buffet

7.45pm: Speeches

8.30pm: Pitches and team formation

10pm: Close

 VENUE 

Were at 113 Somerset Road, National Youth Council Academy- the red building next to Triple One and 2 minutes from Somerset MRT.

Part of a global network of 32 HUBs, we are the first HUB in Asia! HUBs worldwide are hosted environments that actively connect Hubbers, help them to collaborate, accelerate their impact, creating a home in which to co-work, attend events, and run events.

Directions: singapore.the-hub.net/contact

About Membership: singapore.the-hub.net/membership

FB Updates: facebook.com/TheHUBSingapore

Saturday 8th December, 10am – 7pm (venue to be announced)

Teams work together on their ideas all day.

We will have mentor clinics, as well as support from roving experts. You will be

able to sign up to discuss your projects on the day.

Buffet lunch and dinner will be provided, along with tea and coffee breaks.

Sunday 9th December, 10am – 3.30pm (venue to be announced)

10am – 12pm: Teams refine their ideas and work on their presentation.

12pm – 1pm: Working buffet lunch

1pm – 2.30pm: Team presentations

2.30pm – 3pm: Judge’s deliberations.

3pm: Awards and celebrations. Guinness bar opens!

events.name: RedWire
events.about:
RedWire

 because the onlything more dangerous that a hardware guy with a software patch is a software guy with a soldering iron

RedWire is a Hackathon un-conference, where any ideas to create something (useful or not) can be made reality.

The event focuses on the collaborative creation of actual products from wild and wacky ideas for the sheer pleasure of hacking and building something. Weve had many ideas for fun projects bandied around, and its high time we sat down and worked on some of them.

While weve not decided if there are to be prizes awarded to completed projects, we would probably give the most credit for projects that blow our minds, stretch our imaginations, and even fail in spectacular fashion.

As this is an un-confrence, contact us if you want to be involved in the running/setup.

events.name: WOWZAPP 2012: Worldwide Hackathon for Windows -- Singapore
events.about:
Be part of the app revolution!

By registering, you’ll be joining thousands of developers worldwide as we build apps for the next generation of Windows.

Event Agenda and Schedule 

Weve got an exciting 3 days for WOWZAPP 2012!

Look out for lightning talks by our Developer Evangelists, our guest speakers who will be speaking about Game development and using the Parse SDK for Windows 8.

Please take note that the overnight hackathon only begins on the 10th of November at 9am. 

Friday Evening / 9 Nov  (Level 21 Auditorium)
 
6pm – Registration and dinner
 
7pm – WOWZAPP Introduction by Eugene Fabian, Program Manager, Microsoft Bizspark - The Windows 8 Opportunity / Hackathon and  Lightning talks format  / Resources for WOWZAPP
 
730pm – Pitching begins (90 secs each person – were giving away adorable  Fruit Ninja plushies for people who pitch their app ideas! So show us what youve got!
8pm – Team up and form your groups. Its lonely to go through a long hack night by yourself. How about making a couple of friends through this event? Designers and developers, you guys are better together!
830pm – Closing and explanation for WOWZAPP Day 2
9pm – Leave for supper at Lau Par Sat (Optional) 
 
 
Saturday / 10 Nov (Level 21 Auditorium)
 
9am – Breakfast and Hackathon begins! 
 
1030am – 1st Lightning talk by Chris Ismael in  Room 22CF12 - Using Parse SDK to build server-free Windows 8 applications (20mins) 
 
12noon – Lunch
 
2pm – 2nd Lightning talk by Bruce Wang, Senior Developer Evangelist, Microsoft Singaporein Room 22CF12 - The Windows 8 Design Language (20mins)
 
4pm – 3rd Lightning talk by Ty Tianyang, CTO, Tyler Projects in Room 22CF12 - Game Development on Windows 8 (20mins)
 
6pm – Dinner
 
7pm – 4th Lightning talk by Chun Siong Tan, Developer Evangelist, Microsoft Singapore in Room 22CF-12 - Windows Phone 8: Whats new and opportunities for developers (20mins)
 
12 midnight – 4am: Horror movies screening (Resident Evil / The Ring) *Subject to change* 22CF12 / 22BR-01
 
Well be serving some light supper -  instant noodles / milo / biscuits and of course - chips!
 
Sunday / 11 Nov (Level 21 Auditorium)
 
7am - Breakfast
 
830am – Time to Demo apps! (3mins for each team) 
 
10am – Closing session

What to pack for WOWZAPP 2012

WOWZAPP 2012 is designed to be hands on so bring your own machine with Windows 8 installed and the developer tools required to build Windows 8 Applications. Check out theresources on the Windows 8 site to get started on your app now.

Your machine but also remember that it’s the small things that make it work. Power cables, mice, your favorite pair of headphones and if you really need it perhaps an additional monitor. We have touch devices where you can test out your apps!

Oh, did we mention that were giving away an awesome WOWZAPP t-shirt for attendees? But bring along your own towel and some extra underwear if you want to shower!

What to prepare for the pitch

Be clear about what you want to hack, the clearer you are the easier it is for people to join your team and move on to make amazing things. Consider framing your “pitch” to the following format :

1. What is the problem I seek to solve

2. My idea on how to solve it

3. What existing talents/ assets I have that would help me do it

Each person is given precisely 90 seconds to pitch an idea at the beginning of Hack weekend; no slides are required.

If you already have a team – you get to start working on your app without having to pitch! Come speak to the organizers if you need to run through your pitch and get comfortable with it.

Expert Help, Free Resources

Microsoft app experts, developers and trainers will be available on-site to assist your learning and coding. Learn about building Windows Store apps today – download the info, tools and resources you need now. 

Windows Azure Mobile Services

Does your Store app idea include cloud services or storage? Check out Get started withMobile Services –registered student WOWZAPP 2012 participants are eligible for a FREE temporary student Windows Azure subscription!– supplies are limited so be sure to register now!

events.name: NUS ACM | Developer Weekend 2012
events.about:
Developer Weekend is a Hackathon with hands-on technical workshops to encourage enthusiastic beginners as well as pro-developers to take the challenge and get the experience of developing apps for platforms like Windows 8, Android or Web apps. We have mentors and judges to guide you at various points throughout the weekend! This event is open to all students :)

Concept: 

Component1 - Hackathon:

Participants will be given a list of challenges (something we face in real-life) to solve at the start of the event. Students are expected to choose one challenge and solve it using the platform they have chosen. 

Sample challenge question: “Develop something that would help a freshmen in school” (there will be better challenges :P This is just a simple example)

Component 2 - Technical Workshops:

There will be a series of short technical workshops going on side by side. These workshops are open to non-participants as well. 

Given Below is the tentative event flow:

Day1: 22nd September 2012: Saturday

9:30am – 10:00am: Registration 

10:00am – 11:00am: Welcome note, rules & regulations, release of challenge questions

11:00am : Hackathon begins

  • 11:00am – 12:30pm: Windows 8 Workshop
  • 12:30pm – 1:30pm: Android Workshop
  • 1:30pm – 3:00pm: Web Development Workshop
  • 3:00pm – 4:30pm: Windows Azure Workshop (end of workshops)

Overnight Hacking

Day 2: 23rd September 2012: Sunday

9:00am – 10:00am: Breakfast

12:00pm: Hackathon ends

12:00pm -2:00pm: Lunch

2:00pm – 4:00pm: Pitching and Judging

4:00pm -5:00pm: Prize distribution and Vote of thanks

5:00pm onwards: Dinner and Networking

End of event

For more info follow us: 

Website: www.nusacm.org

Facebook: www.facebook.com/nusacm

Twitter: @nusacm

events.name: UP Singapore Urban Prototyping Weekend
events.about:
URBAN PROTOTYPING WEEKEND

Friday 22nd – Sunday 24th June 2012

The Urban Prototyping Weekend is where genius ideas become solutions to pressing urban challenges.

It is a three-day hackathon for urban innovation. The first of its kind in Singapore.

Participants

We are inviting up to 250 of Singapore’s best web and app developers, computer programmers, data analysts, hackers, designers, artists, corporate professionals, government employees, tertiary faculty and students, social entrepreneurs, NGO and NPO employees, and other engaged citizens. You’ll have a large, diverse group from which to create your rock star team. Sign up here for your chance to join.

Data Sandbox

You will also have access a huge and first of its kind Big Data Sandbox, which contains big data, real-time data and open data from dozens of Singaporean organizations. We invite you to play in this sandbox–use it to create solutions to urban challenges that may have been impossible to even imagine beforehand.

Goals

Together, we will create new startups, apps, and projects that change Singapore. And the world.

The best prototypes will be invited to pitch for up to S$250,000 in seed funding and support from NC Venture Partners Incubator.

It is expected that a large number of the prototypes will be mobile and web apps. However, there is also room for the creation of new business models, community engagement strategies and other projects that solve urban challenges.

Themes

We encourage you to innovate in our five main domains, and there’s some information and inspiration on these pages. But it’s up to you.

  • Lifestyles of Health & Sustainability (LOHAS)
  • Education
  • Tourism
  • Creative Arts
  • Community Engagement

What to Expect

Before the weekend:

If you want to take part, sign up here. You will automatically be registered with The Do Good Network. You can use the CoLAB platform to post challenges, participate in solutions, and start chatting with potential team members. Spaces for the UP Weekend are limited and active participants will have priority. The week before the event, participants will be invited to post the solutions they would like to work on at the hackathon. The community will then vote on the ideas they like best. The top 30 projects will be selected for the Urban Prototyping Weekend and will be pitched on the Friday night.

Friday night:

The weekend starts in the early evening with a few speakers who will set the context and provide inspiration for the weekend. The winning projects will be pitched, teams will be formed and will break off to scope out a work plan for the rest of the weekend. You are also open to form teams to work on your own projects, participants are not only restricted to those pitched on the night.

Saturday and Sunday:

These days are work days. Teams research, consult with experts, visit target communities, write code, design interfaces, film video and do whatever else it might take to make their ideas come to life.

Sunday evening:

On Sunday afternoon, teams stop working and prepare brief presentations. Each team will have the chance to present their prototype to the audience and judges.

You can find more details on the schedule here.

Resources and a guide to the hackathon are here.

 

Mentors & Judges

We’ll upload our Mentors and Judges list soon.

Prizes

Yes, we’ll have a load of cool prizes for the winners. They will be announced soon.

events.name: iOS Dev Scout - Hackathon 2012
events.about:
Missed out to SIgnup?
 
Were restricting the number of participants to 50 due to logistical limitations. If you have just missed this signup and are still passionate about taking part in this Hackathon then you can tweet us @iOSDevScout or contact the organizers. Well do our best to accomodate you.

Contact Details: Subh : 8388 7595 | Michael : 9185 5166 | Mugunth : 9727 4850
  

About iOS Dev Scout - Hackathon 2012

iOS Dev Scout (iDS) - Hackathon 2012 (#idsh), is the first iOS centric Hackathon in Singapore. It is a non-profit developer event for iOS, encouraging development using native iOS SDK. The event format is Unconference or Barcamp-style, featuring content from the participants themselves.

This will be a 24 hours (overnight Hackathon) within which participants will pitch their ideas, form teams to build a working prototype or application in 24 hours. The event will start on Saturday (16th June) 9:00 AM and end on Sunday (17th June) 10:30 AM with final demonstrations. iOS Dev Scout will invite potential investors and mentors for final demonstrations. Participants may speak to them during or after the event to get advice on refining their ideas.   

Date & Time

9 AM on 16th June to 10:30 AM on 17th June


Registration Fee: 

This event is free for participants. (Signup Required, Not open for walk-ins)


Food & Drinks:

Food and Drinks will be served at the event venue. 

 

Time Table

  • 9 AM - 10 AM - Registration & Key Note
  • 10 AM - 12 PM - Basic Development Tutorials -  3 Sessions
  • 12 PM - 1 PM - Lunch
  • 1 PM - 3 PM - Idea Pitching
  • 3 PM - 4 PM - Tea Break + Team Formation
  • 4 PM - 7 PM - Planning & Prototyping 
  • 7 PM - 9 PM - Dinner + Show & Tell
  • 9 PM - 1 AM - Coding
  • 1 AM - 2 AM - Supper + Show & Tell 
  • 2 AM - 2:30 AM - Fun Activity (To boost your sprit up and make sure youre not falling asleep)
  • 2:30 AM - 7:30 AM - Coding 
  • 7:30 AM - 8:30 AM - Breakfast
  • 8:30 AM -  10:30 AM - Demo (Potential Investors and Mentors will be present during this sessions)
  • 10:30 AM - Go home!

Sponsors

Many thanks to our sponsors for making this Hackathon happen.

events.name: Facebook Mobile Hack - Singapore
events.about:
Join the Facebook Platform team on March 19 in Singapore at the St. Regis Hotel to get hands-on experience building social mobile apps and games.  We’ll be covering both native and mobile web (HTML5) app development. 

During this program, Facebook will host technical deep-dives, a Q&A, and an opportunity for you and your team to hack on site with Facebook Developers Team assistance.  At the end of the day, awards will be given to the best mobile social apps. 

You may start working on your project right now. Your app does not need to be created from scratch at the event. Capacity is limited and we might not be able to accomodate everyone, so register now to secure your space.

The agenda as it stands today:

The current agenda for the day is as follows:

  • Facebook Mobile Platform Overview
  • Native App development (IOS, Android)  
  • Web Apps (HTML5) development
  • PhoneGap
  • Responsive Design
  • Mobile + Open Graph
  • Partner Presentation
  • Q&A
  • HACK
  • Selection of best apps + Awards

* Please note that this is a very technical event and all content will be in English

events.name: FetchHackers
events.about:
FetchHackers-- open to serious and aspiring FB application and gamification developers. Build a gamification-style app into our FetchFans Facebook design platform templates. Rules are simple: you must hack for 24 hours apps with game mechanics that create amazing user experiences for consumers on behalf of our industry verticals (i.e. apartment property management companies, hotel groups, real estate companies, fitness / health centers) via our FetchFans facebook page builder. At the end of the hackathon you present what youve built to a panel of judges. You get 2 minutes to present.

  • $5,000 cash prize for 1st place hacker
  • $1,000 cash prize for 2nd place hacker
  • iPad 2 for 3rd place hacker
  • Plus two full-time jobs available!

Have questions? contact Carmen direct at carmen@fetchplus.com
